results.title: Bram Stoker's Dracula [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Charles Mulvehill, Fred Fuchs, American Zoetrope and Osiris Films
results.brief_description: Francis Ford Coppola’s lavish new version of Bram Stoker’s classic novel is visually stunning, filled with images of both beauty and horror. James V. Hart’s screenplay sticks fairly close to Stoker’s novel although costuming and special effects give this film a very definite contemporary feel. Dracula is played brilliantly by Gary Oldman, and his arch-rival Dr. Van Helsing is played by Sir Anthony Hopkins. Cast also includes Winona Ryder and Keanu Reeves.

results.title: Out of sight [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Steven Soderbergh, Danny DeVito, Michael Shamberg, Stacey Sher and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Directed by Steven Soderbergh, ‘Out of Sight’ has been adapted from the novel of the same name by Elmore Leonard. When Jack Foley (George Clooney) robs a bank, his car breaks down and he is sent to a Florida prison. His escape attempt is witnessed by Federal Marshall Karen Sisco (Jennifer Lopez) who, as a result, is kidnapped by Foley’s partner, Buddy Bragg (Ving Rhames). Despite being on opposite sides of the law, Foley and Sisco discover their attraction to each other and Sisco is faced with a moral dilemma as she questions whether or not to turn him in.

results.title: American graffiti [DVD]
results.creator_credit: George Lucas, Francis Ford Coppola, Gary Kurtz, Coppola Co Productions and Lucasfilm, Ltd.
results.brief_description: This film from the director of the “Star Wars” trilogy is one of the most popular films of the 1970’s. The misadventures of four Californian teenagers on a late summer night in 1962, two of whom are leaving for college the next day, became the focal point for a trip back to the last “innocent” year of the 1960’s. Features a fine group of young actors who went on to become cinema and TV favourites, including Ron Howard, Richard Dreyfuss and Cindy Williams. The soundtrack features nostalgic hits from the heyday of Rock’n’Roll which takes the viewer back to a more innocent era when life was a lot less complicated. Don’t miss the great cameo appearance from Harrison Ford in the “toughest” role of his career.

results.title: Spartacus [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kubrick, Edward Lewis, Bryna Productions and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Spartacus is a rousing testament to the spirit and dignity of man, dealing with a revolt by slaves against the pagan Roman Empire, based on the novel by Howard Fast. As a spectacle, the clash between the slave army led by Kirk Douglas and the Romans commanded by Laurence Olivier, is nothing short of amazing. Douglas is the mainstay of the picture. He is not particularly expressive, in contrast to the sophisticated Olivier, the conniving parasite gladiator ring operator portrayed by Peter Ustinov or the supple and subtle slave maiden played by Jean Simmons. However, Douglas succeeds admirably in giving an impression of a man who is afire within. Some 8,000 Spanish soldiers became Roman legionnaires for the massive battle sequences filmed outside Madrid, but the rest of the picture was made in Hollywood.

results.title: Dr. Strangelove or How I learned to stop worrying and love the bomb [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kubrick, Victor Lyndon, Columbia and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: A crazy General, Jack D. Ripper, obsessed by the fear that the Communists are controlling the fluoridation of the U.S. water supply, unleashes his wing of H-bombers against Russia. The President of the United States, his Chiefs of Staff at the Pentagon and even the sinister Dr. Strangelove, realise it is too late to call off the attack so they await the awesome consequences. This controversial black comedy stars Peter Sellers in three separate roles; other stars include George C. Scott, Sterling Hayden and Slim Pickens. In turn hilarious, satirical and even terrifying, Dr. Strangelove is a guide on How To Stop Worrying and Love The Bomb.

results.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai [DVD]
results.creator_credit: David Lean, Sam Spiegel, Columbia, Horizon (GB) and Horizon (US)
results.brief_description: Hailed as the greatest war film and distinguished by a visual and narrative sweep rare in modern cinema, David Lean’s masterpiece combines a relentless battle of wills with unparalleled action and spectacle. Based on Pierre Boulle’s best seller and starring Alec Guinness, William Holden and Jack Hawkins, this is the gripping tale of British POWs, captured by the Japanese in World War II and ordered to build a bridge to accommodate the Burma-Siam Railway. Honoured with 7 Academy Awards including Best Picture, Best Actor (Alec Guinness) and Best Director, this film continues to be one of the most memorable cinematic experiences. The bridge demolition scene remains a brilliant piece of stunt photography.

results.title: Gilda [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Charles Vidor, Virginia Van Upp and Colombia Pictures
results.brief_description: This seductive, elegant thriller is a dazzling masterpieces of Hollywood film noir. Johnny (Glenn Ford) is a petty-crim on the Buenos Aires docks who works for the decadent Ballin Mundson (George MacReady), owner of an illegal casino. When Ballin brings his new bride Gilda (Rita Hayworth) to the casino he is unaware that she and Johnny were previously lovers. Her arrival precipitates a chain of jealousy and betrayal which destroys the fragile triangle of relationships. Around this bare plot Charles Vidor creates an atmospheric night-world tinged with the sophisticated ambience of alcohol, gambling and slow sensuous jazz.”Gilda” includes some of the most memorable set pieces in film history including Hayworth’s erotic strip to “Put the Blame on Mame”. The performances are excellent and Glenn Ford and George MacReady manage to defy the strictures of the Hollywood code to convey a rare, at that time, adult bisexuality. However, it is Hayworth who is the glittering centre of this movie.

results.title: In God's hands
results.creator_credit: Zalman King, Tom Stern and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: In God’s Hands follows three friends and surfers around the world in their quest for the perfect wave. They travel to Madagascar, Mexico, Bali and Hawaii where their training is put to the test when faced with 40 foot waves travelling at 35 miles per hour. Includes stunning water photography by Sonny Miller. Cast includes: Patrick Shane Dorian, Matt George, Matty Liu and Shaun Tomson.

results.title: Angela's ashes [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Allan Parker, David Brown, Scott Rudin and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: After immigrating to America, young Frank and his family move back to Limerick following the death of his infant sister. The family is forced to live in the slums of Ireland, with conditions being much worse than they were in America. His Northern Irish father, Malachy, has difficulty finding work because of his former loyalty to the IRA, and what little money he earns, he drinks away, leaving Frank, his mother Angela, and his young brother to scrounge for coal and beg for food and clothing. Determined to escape the poverty, illness, and death that surrounds him in Ireland, Frank dreams of returning to America. Cast includes Emily Watson and Robert Carlyle. Based on the Pulitzer Prize winning autobiography by Frank McCourt.

results.title: eXistenZ = Existenz [DVD]
results.creator_credit: David Cronenberg, Andras Hamori, Robert Lantos, Alliance Atlantis and Serendipity Point Films
results.brief_description: Inspired by a 1995 interview with writer Salman Rushdie, “Existenz” sees Cronenberg apply his perverse and rigorous intellect to a future world in which video game technology and genetic engineering have combined. Allegra Geller (Jennifer Jason Leigh) is a whiz-bang game creator who is the target of an assassination attempt. Geller’s creations simulate the exact sensory and physiological experiences of human reality and she becomes a target of a fundamentalist “realist” cult who object to her experimentation with consciousness. Jude Law plays a young man hired to protect Geller and she introduces him to the labyrinthe, exotic and sometimes terrifying world of virtual reality. Unlike much science-fiction which explores the virtual future, Cronenberg is not as much interested in the possibilities of special effects as he is with the question of what effect do experimentations with computers, designer drugs and genetics have with our ability to understand consciousness and human will. In the near future of “Existenz”, it is not only the human sense of reality that is altered, but our very physical selves. The film itself is a fast paced, ever-changing rollercoaster ride which takes us through myriad permutations of setting and character that in itself unfolds like a video game. As always in Cronenberg’s films, the production design, sound and cinematography is excellent. “Existenz” is a rarity: a film as visceral as it is cerebral.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Cronenberg, Andras Hamori, Robert Lantos, Alliance Atlantis and Serendipity Point Films
